mdRecord.dcterms:title: Portland Place West gate, general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Link, Theodore C. (American architect, St. Louis, MO, 1850-1923) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Theodore C. Link did both the east and west gates of Portland. The gates are usually closed, and access to both streets is via Lake Ave. These, the most palatial of the private places, have been superbly maintained. -- Peters, A Guide to the Architecture of St. Louis, 1989, p. 77, via Google Books [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
gatehouses

mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: Kindshighway Boulevard and Portland Place, Saint Louis, Saint Louis City, Missouri, United States
